description: [Status: stable] [Name: if-expr-with-twisted-arms] [Message: Use {expr_else} if {expr_else} else {expr_body} instead of {expr_body} if not {expr_else} else {expr_else}] What it does Checks for if expressions that check against a negated condition. Why is this bad? if expressions that check against a negated condition are more difficult to read than if expressions that check against the condition directly. Example b if not a else a Use instead: a if a else b
